learning_outcomes.description: Understand the main theoretical concepts of mathematical statistics, and use this understanding to undertake statistical inference on a sound scientific basis.
Recognize the role of modern computational techniques including those based on Monte Carlo methods and apply them to simple practical problems.

assessments.task_description: There will be 4  assignments during the course. Each assignment is worth 10%.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The final examination in this course will be a closed book two hour invigilated exam held during the end-of-semester examination period.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Lectures

  1. Understand the main theoretical concepts of mathematical statistics, and use this understanding to undertake statistical inference on a sound scientific basis.
  2. Recognize the role of modern computational techniques including those based on Monte Carlo methods and apply them to simple practical problems.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Lectures Understand the main theoretical concepts of mathematical statistics, and use this understanding to undertake statistical inference on a sound scientific basis. Recognize the role of modern computational techniques including those based on Monte Carlo methods and apply them to simple practical problems.

learning_activities.topic:
Practicals

  1. Understand the main theoretical concepts of mathematical statistics, and use this understanding to undertake statistical inference on a sound scientific basis.
  2. Recognize the role of modern computational techniques including those based on Monte Carlo methods and apply them to simple practical problems.



Learning outcomes: L01, L02
